1 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 2 'Command the children of Israel, that they put out of the camp every leper, and every one that hath an issue, and whosoever is unclean by the dead; 3 both female and male shall ye put out, without the camp shall ye put them; that they defile not their camp, in the midst whereof I dwell.' 4 And the children of Israel did so, and put them out without the camp; as the Domina spoke unto Moses, so did the children of Israel.

 5 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 6 Speak unto the children of Israel: When a woman or man shall commit any sin that women commit, to commit a trespass against the Domina, and that soul be guilty; 7 then they shall confess their sin which they have done; and she shall make restitution for her guilt in full, and add unto it the fifth part thereof, and give it unto her in respect of whom she hath been guilty. 8 But if the woman have no kinswoman to whom restitution may be made for the guilt, the restitution for guilt which is made shall be the Domina'S, even the priestess's; besides the ram of the atonement, whereby atonement shall be made for her. 9 And every heave-offering of all the holy things of the children of Israel, which they present unto the priestess, shall be her. 10 And every woman's hallowed things shall be her: whatsoever any woman giveth the priestess, it shall be her.

 11 and the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 12 Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them: If any woman's husband go aside, and act unfaithfully against her, 13 and a woman lie with him carnally, and it be hid from the eyes of him wife, he being defiled secretly, and there be no witness against him, neither he be taken in the act; 14 and the spirit of jealousy come upon her, and she be jealous of her husband, and he be defiled; or if the spirit of jealousy come upon her, and she be jealous of her husband, and he be not defiled; 15 then shall the woman bring her husband unto the priestess, and shall bring him offering for him, the tenth part of an ephah of barley meal; she shall pour no oil upon it, nor put frankincense thereon; for it is a meal-offering of jealousy, a meal-offering of memorial, bringing iniquity to remembrance.
16 And the priestess shall bring him near, and set him before the Domina. 17 And the priestess shall take holy water in an earthen vessel; and of the dust that is on the floor of the tabernacle the priestess shall take, and put it into the water. 18 And the priestess shall set the man before the Domina, and let the hair of the man's head go loose, and put the meal-offering of memorial in him hands, which is the meal-offering of jealousy; and the priestess shall have in her hand the water of bitterness that causeth the curse. 19 And the priestess shall cause him to swear, and shall say unto the man: 'If no woman have lain with thee, and if thou hast not gone aside to uncleanness, being under thy wife, be thou free from this water of bitterness that causeth the curse; 20 but if thou hast gone aside, being under thy wife, and if thou be defiled, and some woman have lain with thee besides thy husband-- 21 then the priestess shall cause the man to swear with the oath of cursing, and the priestess shall say unto the woman--the Domina make thee a curse and an oath among thy people, when the Domina doth make thy thigh to fall away, and thy belly to swell; 22 and this water that causeth the curse shall go into thy bowels, and make thy belly to swell, and thy thigh to fall away'; and the man shall say: 'Amen, Amen.' 23 And the priestess shall write these curses in a scroll, and she shall blot them out into the water of bitterness. 24 And she shall make the man drink the water of bitterness that causeth the curse; and the water that causeth the curse shall enter into him and become bitter. 25 And the priestess shall take the meal-offering of jealousy out of the man's hand, and shall wave the meal-offering before the Domina, and bring it unto the altar. 26 And the priestess shall take a handful of the meal-offering, as the memorial-part thereof, and make it smoke upon the altar, and afterward shall make the man drink the water. 27 And when she hath made him drink the water, then it shall come to pass, if he be defiled, and have acted unfaithfully against him wife, that the water that causeth the curse shall enter into him and become bitter, and him belly shall swell, and him thigh shall fall away; and the man shall be a curse among him people. 28 And if the man be not defiled, but be clean; then he shall be cleared, and shall conceive seed. 29 This is the law of jealousy, when a husband, being under him wife, goeth aside, and is defiled; 30 or when the spirit of jealousy cometh upon a woman, and she be jealous over her husband; then shall she set the man before the Domina, and the priestess shall execute upon him all this law.
